slides.title: Police Hierarchy
slides.content:
**State Police Ranks (Top to Bottom):**
1. Director General of Police (DGP)
2. Additional DGP
3. Inspector General (IG)
4. Deputy Inspector General (DIG)
5. Senior Superintendent (SSP)
6. Superintendent (SP)
7. Additional SP, DSP
8. Inspector, Sub-Inspector
9. Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI)
10. **Constable** (Entry Level)

slides.title: Police Duties & Responsibilities
slides.content:
**Main Duties:**
- Maintain law & order
- Prevent & detect crime
- Protect life & property
- Traffic regulation
- Help during emergencies

**Constable Role:**
- Patrol duties, beat work
- First responder to incidents
- Assist in investigations
- Crime prevention in community

slides.title: Police Departments
slides.content:
**Specialized Units:**
- Crime Branch (investigation)
- Traffic Police
- Women & Child Helpline
- Cyber Crime Cell
- Special Task Force
- Reserve Police

**Control Room:** 100 (Emergency), 1091 (Women), 1098 (Child)

question.questionText: What is the primary emergency police helpline number in India?
question.explanation: 100 is the traditional police emergency number. 112 is the unified emergency number for all services.
